predictor of fat-free mass rather than fat mass. Further investigations are therefore needed to establish the 
optimum minimum and maximum birth weights according to gestational age.
•   Although adverse effects are associated with both high and low GWG, only one set of guidance (by the IoM) 
[97] exists on the amount of weight that should be gained during “normal” pregnancy, and none on how 
much an obese pregnant woman should gain/lose, especially according to obesity classification
